inn1.comm: hint of swing away outside off, on a length, left alone
shorter of length, played off his toes to the off side
fuller, brings him onto the front foot, driven back to the bowler without much timing
excellent fielding at backward point, Azhar cuts at a short, wide delivery and Roy flings himself to his left
good delivery, bounces a touch more at Azhar who takes his bottom hand off the bat as he defends
back of a length outside off, jabbed square towards point, and Woakes starts with a maiden
an appeal for lbw straightaway, it's a 90mph delivery, does Sharjeel for pace but it pitch well outside leg stump
beaten! This one is full outside off, sliding across the left hander, and that's a nervous prod as he tries to get on the front foot
crunched! That's a good response, short outside off, Sharjeel is on the back foot and sees it early, pulling handsomely through midwicket. Take that. Challenge laid down
a bouncer, 92.5mph, and he ducks underneath
nearly draged on! But he gets a boundary. Two sides of pace, there. Sharjeel playing a flat-footed cut, gets a bottom edge which scoots past the stumps to fine leg
that's a beauty...terrific delivery to end a lively first over. Just back of a length, nips off the seam and beats the outside edge as Sharjeel tried to withdraw his bat
can't get off the mark yet, plays a back-of-a-length delivery to point
latches on to a loose delivery, dragged down short and wide, throws his hands through a cut shot, probably takes more top edge than he wanted but gets it well over the slips and fine of third man
back on a full length outside off, 86mph, defended with an angled bat to backward point
gets forward outside off, runs off an open face down to third man
pushed across outside off, Sharjeel takes his bat well inside the line
gets a touch too straight, whipped off his pads to long leg
back of a length at off stump, 92mph, defended towards backward point and that's a good call from Azhar to get through for the single
full at off stump, 92mph, defended back to the bowler
a bouncer outside off at 92mph, Azhar ducks out of the way
delivery from wide of the crease, full at the stumps, flicked to deep square leg
full, wide outside off, left alone...too wide
well bowled, an appeal for lbw as this nips back in at Azhar, strikes him as he gets forward...looked outside the line and he may have hit it as well
back of a length outside off, 91mph, defended to backward point
nudged to the leg side, another sharp single....Woakes follows through, aims to kick the ball into the stumps and that would have been out!
short ball outside off, he rides the bounce and angles it down to third man
full outside off, chopped into the pitch and it bobbles to backward point
that's a slog, heaves a length ball from outside off through midwicket...not textbook, but effective
another appeal for lbw, Sharjeel going for a pull against a full delivery...may have pitched outside leg again. Not worth a gamble on the DRS. Yep, outside leg
another short ball, he's quickly on the pull and slots it down to long leg...pretty confident start from Sharjeel

gone this time! Wood strikes on his return. A short ball, 91mph, angled across outside off, he goes for the pull, the ball is on him quickly, and takes the top edge. Well, Sharjeel has called the review here. There is mark on Snicko. He's gone. Wasted review, really
full outside off, 92mph, on the front foot and defends to cover
angled in, on a full length, worked off the pads down to long leg
full at off stump, defended towards mid-off
back of a length outside off, angled to backward point
a shorter ball, at the body, swivels on a pull and finds long leg
that's climbed outside off, a short delivery, good bounce and Azhar is quite late pulling his bat away
dropped at gully by Alex Hales! Some width, Azhar slashed at it, but Hales shells the chance just to his right then says he didn't pick the ball up
back of a length outside off, defended to cover
full outside off, strides forward then leaves alone
that's a lovely delivery, full outside off, slightly tighter to off stump, brings Azhar into a drive and it shades past the outside edge
back of a length at off stump, defended to the on side, another maiden for Woakes
worked off the hip to long leg
short of a length, 87mph, angled on the hip and takes the thigh guard to the leg side

another chance? Yes, a drop to Buttler. A glance down the leg side, gets a decent bit of Wood on it, flies to Buttler's left and he can't grab it with a dive. Tough, but Buttler will be annoyed with that
back of a length at off stump, defended to mid-on
gets forward and defends towards point
nearly spoons this to the leg side, did it stop on him a little? As it is, goes to ground before midwicket. Was actually a cross-seamer from Plunkett
that's a ripper! Back of a length at off stump, nips off the seam to beat Azhar's outside edge. Too good
full outside off, left alone
gets across his stumps and works this from outside off to square leg
good length outside off, 85mph, this carries on the rise to Buttler who takes it at head height. Good carry
pushed on the pads, flicked between midwicket and mid-on, nice piece of timing and the outfield does the rest
back on off stump, defended to the bowler
short ball outside off, he pulls and there's a good diving save at midwicket by Jordan (who was on for Wood, and is  now on for Moeen)
short again and this time he pulls it handsomely through square leg, manages to get over the top of it enough so not to spoon it high in the air as he did in the Test series

big appeal for lbw! Going down on the angle? Well, Morgan has called for the review. No bat, this looks close. Maybe umpire's call on leg stump. Yes, hitting leg stump but not by enough. Would need another look at that to see if it would be out under the new margins coming in soon
full at off stump, 87mph, defended
that's a good shot, whips a ball away from middle and leg, goes deliberately in the air towards deep square
defended from outside off to point
flicked from outside off towards midwicket
gets forward and nudges to the leg side
full outside off, defended on the front foot
tossed up at off stump, aims to drive through the off side but picks out cover
uses his feet then eases this along the ground to long-off
pushed down the leg side, Azhar catches up with and deflects towards short fine leg
full at off stump, 90mph, played back to the bowler
gets on the front foot and drives to mid-off...still a bit of a struggle for Azhar
fuller still, again drives to mid-off
some width this time, cuts hard but picks out Roy at backward point
glanced wide of a diving Buttler, don't think this one carried, tickles the edge and also takes pad down the leg side...runs away to fine leg. Well, might have carried but no glove on it
full and straight, driven firmly to mid-on
was that the knuckle ball? Just shaped away from Hafeez as he defended to the off side

top edge, and caught at deep square leg! Another in and out for Hafeez. Goes for the sweep, isn't able to keep it down, Hales manages to gather this one in the deep but doesn't celebrate much. Relief, perhaps.
full outside off, the bottom hand comes in to play as he whips to long-on
flicked off the pads to short fine leg
worked away from leg stump into square leg
goes back to a shorter delivery and flicks to deep midwicket
short outside off, 87mph, he drops his bat out of the line
full at off stump, 90mph, defended to the covers
beaten outside off as he goes for the cut, scoots under the bottom edge
pushes a fuller ball towards mid-on
full and straight, a nicely timed push but straight to mid-on
a controlled outside edge down to third man
very full outside off, dug out down the ground
goes back to a very short ball outside off and dispatches it through the covers for a pressure-relieving boundary
worked off the pads, wide of a diving leg slip
pushed down to long-on
touch more flight, held back a little, turned to short fine leg
much fuller, flicked down to long-on...Root skips through another over
full at off stump, a solid drive wide of mid-off
shorter outside off, 91mph, he goes for the cut but the ball is through him, over the top edge
full again outside off, another compact drive between cover and mid-off, chased down by the captain
a bouncer, angling in at off stump, Azhar bends his knees and arches out of the line
full at off stump, 90mph, driven firmly into the pitch and back at Wood, who gets a hand on it while falling over in his follow through
gets well forward and defends to the covers
flicked down to long-on
wider outside off, dabbed behind point
full and wide, laced through the off side...Azam has started well and this is a confident boundary
fired down the leg side, he'll have to bowl that again (well, not that exact ball)
uses his feet and tucks this off his pads
shorter ball, worked to the leg side
another strong drive through the off side, full and too wide, not timed quite as well on this occasion and Wood can chase it down
quick, short, 90mph, beats the attempt to go for the pull
banged in short, more sharp pace but that's his second bouncer of the over. Needs to pitch it up now
fuller, and slashed through the palms of Jason Roy at backward point. It wasn't a catch but it wasn't picked up either
back of a length, and an angled dab into the cordon
full and straight, and an impeccable forward defence
short and a touch wide, but Roy at backward point this time picks up the ball cleanly off the bat and prevents the single
tidy line and length, and a respectful dab into space
shuffling onto the back foot to pierce the covers
fully forward and blocked back down the track
a hint of spin from outside off, but that's good running, a tip-and-run single to point
clipped into the leg-side, but can't find the gap
down the track, but merely to meet the pitch of the ball. Another single to long-on and five for the over
stands tall on the back foot and eased to short midwicket
crashing cut but Roy is in a hurry to make amends for that fumble two overs ago. Another sharp diving stop low to his left
flapped to Roy once more at point, who dives to his right, palms the ball to Stokes, who takes a pop at the stumps but doesn't quite pick it off
another bouncer, sharp aggression once more
dabbed out to point and through they scamper
another single through to the off side
onto the front foot, and half an appeal for lbw. No reviews left, so no quibbling with that one. Outside the line at any rate, albeit a well-disguised cutter
faster and flatter and half an appeal as the ball deflects off the pad
leaning onto the front foot, a pretty-looking drive, but straight to the man
smartly played, sliding across the stumps to nurdle the ball exceedingly fine past the man behind square
tightens up on off stump and pushed into the off side
tapped through midwicket, another simple single to bring up the hundred at a decent lick
stoutly blocked to finish the over
promising start, tossed up high then dipping late on off stump. Pushed out to point
a touch wider but a probing length, crunched to mid-off without much timing
shorter, tapped through point
leaning forward, poked back to the bowler
forward to defend
worked out to the off side, a very tidy start
turning from middle to leg and helped with the angle through backward square
hustling into position for a push into the covers
solid defence back down the track
crashed out to backward point
eased square

stoutly into line to defend. England happy to whittle down the overs, Pakistan happy to bide their time... it's the Boring Middle Overs (TM) but, seeing as we are all still in Test mood, it is nothing short of fascinating. Right?
worked into the leg side
leaning onto the front foot, a controlled push to long-off
well bowled, a genuine legbreak that pitched middle-and-leg and turned into a calm defensive push
tapped into the covers, on the front foot
a fraction shorter, and this time Babar has had enough of standing on ceremony. A dirty hoick up and over wide long-on, one bounce and over the rope...

what a riposte from Rashid! A faster, flatter googly, strikes the pad, via a slender slice of inside-edge, but there there's no recourse for Babar after Shajeel's daft review earlier in the innings. He has to go!
strikes the pad again,  but this one is sneaking down leg
eased up to midwicket
forward and blocked
forward and crunched to long-on
worked into the gap once again
Sarfraz keeps the strike with some more measured nurdling
full length, on middle and leg, chiselled into the leg-side
sliding back into the crease and pushed to point
poked to short cover
worked into the covers
low full toss, met with a full face and squeezed through midwicket for a welcome boundary. Sarfraz's quick feet made that opportunity
dragged down, but Sarfraz's wipe through the line doesn't quite connect
swept fine to escape the strike
down the track and tapped to mid-on
forward and defended once again
clipped to midwicket
clipped into the leg-side again
defended on the back foot, waiting for the ball to arrive and tapping to point
poked to the off side
down on the sweep, Plunkett struggled to sight that at deep midwicekt
a well-measured tap to short midwicket, and because he was so far onto the front foot, he is able to snaffle two from a nothing shot. Well played
up on the toes with a push to cover
full length, probing the blockhole and driven to cover
good finish, a touch wider on the crease and perhaps spinning more sharply. A dot to finish the over
tight line and respectful defence
joining the dots with a probing length
worked into the gap at short midwicket
a big stride, a well-worked nurdle into the leg-side and up comes Azhar's fifty. Well played, sir, but he's used up 84 balls to get there. He must go on now...
flicked to leg once more
eased into the leg side, and only two runs from another boa-like over
up on the toes, poked out to point
forward to defend
worked into the gap, a bit of a tight squeeze as the shy comes in
swept firmly, a bit of a top-edge, but always safe as Azhar picks up the pace
good comeback, drawing Azhar forward to defend back to the bowler
googly, and Azhar didn't look as though he picked that, galloping to leg to make room for a fierce cut, then hastily re-adjusting as the ball zipped back towards him
drawn forward and picked up at mid-on
worked to leg from a straight line
crashed out to backward square with an emphatic sweep
worked to leg
worked around the corner to backward square
shorter and sliding towards leg stump. Another nudge to midwicket brings another tight over to an end
drawn forward and poked back down the pitch
flicked off the pads to square leg
up on the toes and punched to cover. Roy, again, is lively with his intercept

there we go, that's the belligerence that Pakistan need to bring to the fore. A touch more flight, so Azhar sends his front leg into exile to pound the ball up and over the head of the bowler. One bounce
tapped to cover
can't get this one away as Rashid fires in another googly to beat an ambitious charge down the track. The thigh pad intercepts to save Sarfraz from a stumping
seeking the single but Stokes is lively to cut it off
up on the toes in an attempted glide down to third man
banged in short, and Azhar swings into a pre-meditated pull. Doesn't connect perfectly, but perfecly well all the same, into the gap at cow corner
defended
too wide, and an easy wallop through point
defended into the leg side, no run there
an inside-out tonk over wide mid-off! Splendid shot, didn't try to over-hit it, just got right to the pitch of the  ball and let his bat do the rest
worked into the covers with less intent this time
tossed up, spins wide, and helped through point
forward, and blocked down the track
googly, this time Azhar does pick it, and shovels a flick from outside off to mid-on
swept with intent, Wood sweeps round from fine leg to tidy up
angling into the right-hander, defended back up the pitch, on the back foot
a fraction short, and Azhar swings into a baseball slap through mid-off! Never quite there for the shot but Morgan can't intercept and that's more valuable runs
crunched to backward point where Roy is once again alert
another ambitious thwack, on the up through the leg-side, but mid-on gathers on the bounce. Plunkett gives him the stare in his folllowthrough
eased down to long-on
guided down to third man, an over brimming with intent, and Pakistan are looking threatening as the final 15 approach
sweeps a full, straight delivery to deep square...Sarfraz has helped bring some life to this innings
fetches this from outside off and slog-sweeps along the ground to deep midwicket
comes down the pitch, Rashid may have seen him coming, drags the length and it's swung to deep square
touch more air this time, encourages Azhar to hit in the air, inside-out over extra cover, places it between the outfielders

but gone this time! Rashid holds his nerve, gives it a bit of air again, Azhar keen to press on, goes for a big slog sweep from outside off, gets a fat top edge which loops to Moeen at short third man
full delivery, played to midwicket
a bouncer, lets it travel over his head
back of a length, at off stump, defended back to the bowler
gets forward to a fuller ball, pushed square to the off side
full and straight, shuffles across the crease and tucks behind square on the leg side
flicks a length delivery to deep square
well bowled, beats Sarfraz's edge with a 90mph delivery that just straighten on him outside off
waits for this to turn and drives off the back foot to deep point
not sure this quite carries to deep midwicket! Good attempt by Plunkett running in. Was dragged down by Rashid, Sarfraz went back and pulled
a strangled appeal for lbw as he misses a sweep...heading leg side
uses his feet, pulls the length back, pushed to the off side
touch slower through the air, grips a little, played to the off side
quite full to cut but he manages to get it to deep point
full at off stump, driven just to the left of mid-off
short delivery, gets over the top of it and pulls to deep square
on off stump, angled down to third man
angled in at leg stump, flicks down to long leg
a rather loopy bouncer, umpires say that is okay on height
short again, not quite as high this time so he's able to pull to long leg
full, angled towards the pads, can't get bat on it
outside off, runs it down to third man
that's a good blow, uses his feet, drags it wider than he probably wanted, but comfortably clears mid-on
short, pulled to deep square leg
short of a length outside off, 89mph, angled down to third man
for a moment think he was going to play something more powerfully, but in the ends dabs a wide ball to third man
he's middled that...to deep midwicket for a single. Such is the one-day game. Short on off stump and he connected sweetly with his pull
full outside off, slower ball, angled to third man
full, around middle and leg, worked to long leg
full at middle and off, driven to long-on
works a length ball through midwicket, placed nicely wide of the sweeper...Jordan is on the field again, I've lost track who for
tries to spear in a yorker, misses by just a fraction and, well, there's a collector's item - Jordan has made a mess of it at deep midwicket and gives away a boundary.
back of a length on off stump, another glide to third man
played to third man again
digs out a full ball to the off side
pushes this down the leg side
plays and misses as he tries to send another ball to third man
short, doesn't quite middle the pull this time, finds deep square leg and an extra run when Stokes' throw hits the stumps and rebounds away
angled down to third man, fine enough to return for the second, and that's a very good fifty off 52 deliveries
short and pulled sweetly out to deep square leg
short of a length outside off, angled to third man
slashes and misses outside off, hint of width, he was looking for a powerful cut
back of a length, worked to midwicket
plays a more controlled guide down to third man this time
on a length at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
short of a length, angled towards backward point
whipped away from off stump to deep midwicket
full and straight, 88mph, bunted down the ground with a straight bat
gives himself room outside leg, it's a full ball which he heaves down to long-on
that's pretty simple...full ball on off stump, Malik goes for the drive and just spoons a catch to mid-off who barely had to move
round the wicket, back of a length, defended to the on side
short outside off, carved over the covers to the sweeper
short on off stump, pulled down to long-on

and another catch for mid-off! That's a big blow for Pakistan. A full delivery, Sarfraz just moved to the leg side to try and open up the off but couldn't get underneath the ball enough and provided a simple catch. Think Woakes may have rolled his fingers over that one
short ball, over of leg stump, he goes for a hook and there's an appeal for a catch behind but it missed bat and glove
outside off, fairly wide, guided to third man
goes for a cut, a little cramped for room and it takes the bottom edge
round the wicket, short ball angled in at the body, takes the glove as he pulls and Buttler dives to his right
full outside off, 90mph, push-and-run towards mid-off
slower ball, wide outside off, can't squeeze it through point
a well-directed bouncer, follows the batsman as he sways out of the line...another dot. Been all England since the rain
manages to get this one through the in-field, a slower ball, on a length and he clubs it between cover and mid-off
dragged down short and that's crunched through midwicket, he certainly middled that one...good finish to the over by Nawaz after the pressure had built
full on middle and off, played back to Wood
an appeal for lbw, as previously that's probably pitched outside leg, Imad playing acrossthe line
short of a length on leg stump, tucked to long leg
a sharp bouncer, beats Imad's attempt to pull...only goes down as 84mph, but it skidded through
clubbed without much timing towards mid-off
full outside leg, sweetly clipped off his pads and that's a good piece of running to make that into a second
angled across, short outside off, he swings and gets a thick top edge towards third man
slower ball outside off, 69mph, defeats Nawaz and goes through to Buttler
tries to flay this through the off side but can only pick out mid-off
a yorker, dug out towards midwicket
another slower ball, flogged down the ground to long-on
short ball, splices this into midwicket but wide of any fielders
swung in the air over point wide of the cover sweeper
tries to give himself room to find space in the off side but can only pick out mid-off on the edge of the circle
fuller delivery, this one is middled better but again can't beat mid-off
that's a swift bouncer at 88mph and another dot, although the batsman thinks that should have been a wide. He has a point, too
short, but not as short, pulled to deep midwicket
he's creamed that! Full, straight and drilled down the ground as he gives himself a fraction of room to the leg side.
round the wicket, full and straight, clubbed to deep midwicket
a lot of moving round the crease from Imad and he ends up trying to scoop a full ball but just gets ends up kicking it to short fine leg
full, angled outside leg stump, clipped to deep midwicket...just single
low full toss outside off, driven straight to cover and there's a chance of a run out but the throw is wide
back of a length, swings a bottom edge into the pitch and bounces back to the bowler
doesn't get this off the middle as he swings to the leg side and it's a single to long-on

inn2.comm: decent length from round the wicket, and a hasty slap into the off side
good length, angling into the right-hander and met with a firm punch
on the back foot, driven uppishly to cover
England are up and running with a measured push to deep cover
chopped out to point, still no turn for the left-armer.
pushed back up the pitch, a tidy but very unthreatening over
too short, and the only swing on offer is the swing of Roy's bat across the line. Thwacked through midwicket with relish
better length, and an ideal defensive line, just inside the tramlines so no wide as Roy leaves alone hopefully
tighter line, and good lift as the ball nips back into the right-hander, inside-edged through backward square
up on the toes, and crunched through the covers. Another loose ball, too short, too wide. Too easy to put away
that's better! Fuller, straighter, lifting off the deck and taking the edge, but dropping just short of slip
left well alone outside off stump. A tidier end to the over
decent shape at a good pace back into the right hander. Defended

remarkable shot ... almost French cricket in its origins, as Roy rotated like a sentinel, and punched the bat purely with his wrists straight off the face through midwicket. Timed to perfection, like a well-boiled egg
tighter line, and a loud shout of 'no!'
a very similar dispatching through wide long-on. Roy working on length and timing, and he's clobbering it
that is tremendous batting. Two punches off the legs, and now an uppercut through the covers as Gul adjusts his line and strays too wide.
defended back down the track.
outside off, a calm club through the covers
well-timed punch on the up through cover,  but half a hand takes the sting off the ball
forward and defended, blocked back down the track
tapped out to mid-off
on the pads, and flicked through midwicket. A perfect lack of pace allows them to run hard and turn for the second before deep square could close in
outside off, punched on the up to cover. Roy still doesn't look entirely convinced in his own wellbeing
Hales takes his turn to pick the gap well and they return for the second
up on the toes, pushed to cover

beautiful bowling! Outside off, feinting back to graze Hales' edge as he opened the face in a bid to steer the  ball through third man, but the ball was too close and took control of his intentions. A fine stooping take at a solitary slip and Pakistan strike early!
speared down the leg-side, very full and a bit of swing too, but misdirected in the first instance
angling into the pads and defended into the leg side
punched on the up and a fumble in the covers gifts Root his first run
pulled around the corner in measured, almost tentative fashion. Another run, but I'm not convinced he's entirely with it at the moment
outside off, and this is excellently played - maybe instinct over-rides everything else - as Roy opens the face and squeezes a push through backward point
worked out to point once more
fuller length, and tighter line, that zips past the edge at 87mph as Root pushes with hard hands through the perceived line. But now you see it, now you don't
firm drive, into the covers once more. And Babar fumbles to gift Root another single
slower ball, Roy waits with angled bat, and defends to the cordon

smashed high and violently into the evening sky! Who wants this? Sarfraz calls and sprints, even though Gul at square leg was right under the ball all the time. The gloves made it the keepers call, but he wasn't steady enough, and dropped!
strikes the pad via a big inside edge. No bother with an appeal
tapped to point and through they scamper
sliding down the leg side, another extra to England's cause
on the pads, timed sweetly out to deep midwicket
forward and punched to mid-on
flicked square once more
spanking drive! Too wide to a man in this sort of form. Dizziness or no dizziness, that is dispatched with violence through the covers
right on top of the bounce with a full-faced drive. Leaning into the  ball and easing it to the rope
defended this time, a much tighter line
fatal width once more, and that is scorched through point with timing and placement. There's no stopping that
tight line, and defended
open face, and a glide through third man
looking for two, settling for one. Another productive over for England
leg-sided, and helped through fine leg, off the thigh pad
leg-sided once more, and clipped with good timing to midwicket
tight line, cranking up the pace
that's a lovely ball, 90mph already, and zipping with lift and late away movement past a half-formed prod. The slips are alert...
on the pads now, clipped to square leg
banged in shorter, attempted pull but under-edged into the crease
round the wicket, good line and length, defended
looped up, but leg-sided, an easy clip in front of square
good length, attacking the off stump, but Roy is alert and flings his hands through the line to push to cover
tight once more, a good over so far, picked up in the followthrough
down the leg side, clips the pad and they nick a single
good delivery to finish, fired in fast and flat to bring out a firm defensive jab
over the wicket, tight line into Roy's hip, and they put square leg under pressure with more urgent running
squared up in defence, but safely so as they push a single to midwicket
tight line again, defended
lifting into a back-foot steer to point and that's another single
flicked square for another single
clipped in front of square, into the gap, and they cross for the second. Runs and gaps galore
tight line and a full length, defended to short midwicket
a bit of spin from a full length, beats a loose drive but strikes the pad
bang. Roy's had enough of pat-ball, so drops to his knees, clubs on the up over backward square, and that is the first six of the day!
good follow-up, a calm punch to cover and a single to reassess from the non-striker's end
defended to cover
full-faced drive, eased into the gap at long-off
open-faced steer out to point
up on the toes, and slapped backward of point with more expert placement
full length, and Roy is a touch early on a hard-handed push through the line. Mid-off is briefly in business but the ball falls short
on the hip, angled defence to backward square, more insta-calling
tight line, full length, solid defence to mid-off
full again, angled into the cordon
round the wicket, cracked square
too short, chopped on the up through the covers
forward and defended to mid-on
well bowled, this one grips from an off-stump line and Root has to readjust late to defend his stumps
poked into the off side
full length but a fraction straighter, and this is an easy squeeze down the ground. Half-stopped by the bowler, but can't cut off the run
tapped into the gap
on the back foot, driven on the up into the covers
width and a mistimed cut still results in a sharp single to backward point
a hint of width, a flash of blade, and Roy brings up a superb fifty with a crunching cover drive. Well batted that man
takes a bit of splice out to midwicket, but another single
on the toes, flicked square
short outside but Roy can't take advantage
pushed a full ball wide of midwicket down to long-on and that's more excellent running
pushed comfortably down the ground
nearly gets one through Root as he goes back to quite a full ball that skids on, takes an inside edge to fine leg
full on off stump, pushed to long-off
full outside leg, Root gets over the top of a sweep which rolls to fine leg...he's fell a couple of ways that season, but fully under control this time
tucked to midwicket
short from round the wicket, very gentle, whipped to deep midwicket
goes back to a short ball, pushed to the bowler
whipped to long-on
uses his feet, swings this over wide mid-on, gets it in the gap but wasn't quite timed
short again, outside off, punched down to long-off

my goodness, that is an astonishing shot...he gets across his crease and plays a straight-bat lofted drive over midwicket. Brilliance. Even Roy allows himself a little grin. Dare we say, a touch of KP
dropped towards point
short of a length outside off, 84mph, angled down to third man
defends a shortish delivery, drops down by his feet and bounces back towards the stumps but out of harms way and he's called through for the run
flicks a length delivery to midwicket
back-cuts down to third man
full, driven back to the bowler
gets forward, opens the face and steers it through the covers
uses his feet and ends up yorking himself, back to the bowler

has he given it away, yes he has! Coming down the pitch again, tries to clear the straight boundary, gets a bit too far underneath it but it still almost clear the rope yet Babar Azam takes a superbly-judged catch running around the rope.
full, pushed down the ground
stays round the wicket to the left hander, tucks a shortish ball through the leg side
nudged off the pads to deep square
gets nicely inside the line, tucked off the pads to long leg
hint of width, back of a length, Morgan slashes a square cut which goes through point...poor fielding
round the wicket, back of a length, defended to the leg side
a bouncer, goes over Morgan's head...one for the over
outside off, left alone
round the wicket, full, eased down the ground
flicked in the air, but short of midwicket...Morgan goes back to a shorter ball, which didn't come on to him, and nearly spooned a catch
goes back this time, outside off, cut behind point
deep in the crease and flicks through midwicket
gets forward, takes this from around off stump through the leg side
a very neat, late sweep from Root, was a full ball outside off and he got right over the top of the ball and sent it very fine
round the wicket, outside off, left alone
gets this very fine, a deft late cut wide of the lone slip, he looked fully in control although it came off the toe end
comes forward to a length ball and drives to the cover sweeper
drives to backward point
across the stumps and whips this through midwicket
full outside off, comes forward to drive and finds cover
glances off the pad and Sarfraz can't cut it off
low full toss gets driven to long-off
touch short around leg stump, Morgan goes back and works it to deep square
outside leg stump and Root plays another well-controlled sweep to fine leg which takes him to fifty
that's a ripper! Tossed up on off stump, this grips and spins past the outside edge...that's what Azhar was hoping for when he batted, but has it come too late with too few runs to work with?
pushed to the covers
round the wicket, on off stump, defended. There's a slip in place
good line, brings him forward, played to the covers
touch shorter, he goes back and drives to long-off
round the wicket, full on the stumps, flicked to midwicket
dragged down short, it's dying as it reaches Root but he's able to pull
nearly spoons a catch to backward point, played his cut a fraction early but the ball landed short of the fielder
pushed to the covers
flicked to midwicket
hint of turn here, squares up Root, nearly gets a leading edge
touch short outside off, driven to deep cover
some sharper turn this time, from just short of a length, spins in to Morgan's pads, takes him on the thigh guard
played off the back foot to the on side
some spin for Malik too, from over the wicket this time, played to the on side
gets forward and tucks a fuller delivery to long-on
round the wicket, goes for the reverse sweep, doesn't make contact
straighter delivery, nudged wide of mid-on
opens the face and dabs this wide of short third man
goes on with the air, punched down the ground
plays back and defends
dragged down a little short, pushed off the back foot to long-on
round the wicket, exposes his stumps as he drives square to the off side
he's swept so well this evening, picks off a low full toss, all along the ground behind square. Easy pickings
finds midwicket off the front foot
driven back to the bowler
short of a length outside off, pushed square to the cover sweeper
short, outside off, Root jumps to get on top of the ball and pulls to deep midwicket
played to mid-off
beats the outside edge as Morgan plays away from his body at a back-of-a-length delivery

he's gone with a direct hit! Huge wicket for Pakistan. Was dropped to the off side by Morgan, it was he who called the run, Root responded but it was a poor piece of judgement from the skipper, and Root is well short as Azhar hit the stumps coming in from cover. Is that the inspiration for Pakistan?
back of a length on off stump, 88mph, defended
worked to the leg side
round the wicket, full on leg stump, flicked to deep square leg
short outside off, cracked firmly through the off side and wide enough of long-off for the second
defended on the front foot
pushed to the covers
angled on the pads but Morgan can't beat short fine leg with his flick
width outside off, Stokes throws everything at his cut, flies off the top half of the bat and carries quite a long way towards third man
short outside off, pulled without any great timing to deep midwicket
back of a length, defended
beats the edge, gets it fuller, draws Stokes forward and the ball holds its line off the seam
driven to cover
pulled down to long leg
short outside off, driven to the sweeper
defended towards point, Stokes sets off the run but Morgan isn't going anywhere
tight at off stump, defended
shorter and is pulled to deep square
a well-timed defensive push finds mid-on
back of a length, punched to the covers and there's a good save
dragged down short outside leg but it only costs a single as Morgan pulls to deep square...still looking hard work for the captain
flicks a shortish delivery to deep midwicket
whipped to midwicket
full outside leg stump, Morgan gets his sweep away fine enough to beat deep square leg this time
short outside off, cut to the cover sweeper
so close! Stokes almost drags this on as he goes back to force through the off side and it takes a bottom edge into his boot
defends a length ball and gets a thick inside edge into his pads
chops this down to third man
he slams a shortish delivery straight to cover but then gets two runs for his efforts as the throw is wild and not backed up. Might have been the throw, to be fair, with Morgan struggling to get back
a few more bonus runs as Wahab flings down a very short bouncer and it balloons over a leaping Sarfraz
gets hold of some width and slashes to deep cover
short outside off, Morgan plays a poweful cut which goes behind point...was in the air for quite a long way
short outside off, he lets it go through
attempted reverse sweep, misses out, to loud squeaks of concern
that's a tasty shot. Full face of the bat, just a push through mid-on. Timed with alacrity
clipped to the leg side
swept through backward square, picked up on the boundary's edge
onto the front foot, crunched into the covers
worked square for another measured single
pushed onto the back foot, can't work it square
down on one knee for a controlled sweep
punched back down the pitch
